main event: Two electrical engineers observed a bright object resembling a ball of fire moving from the northeast to the southwest in Houston.
interesting points: The object was described as having the color of an arc weld and was estimated to be the size of an orange, The sighting lasted between 5 to 10 seconds, The object moved at an estimated speed of over 1,000 miles per hour, Observers described the object as having no trail, and it disappeared suddenly into the southwest, The observation took place during a thunderstorm with flashes of lightning in the vicinity.
sighted object: a ball of fire with no visible trail
witness description: two electrical engineers observing from a third floor window of the power plant
